result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua R Pientka was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Joshua R Pientka was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Joshua R Pientka was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $600 plus costs. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.

Not to operate an automobile unless absolute sober. 
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

AODA and DOT assessments. 
Complete any other program deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and Department of Corrections. 
Submit DNA sample.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge under blessinger.

BY THE COURT:

14CF252
Court informs of the potential penalties.
Defendant enters a plea of:  NC
Ct 3 - possession of THC as subsequent offense:  NC

Court questions Defendant regarding plea and plea questionnaire.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Defendant.  No statement of the defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is sufficient factual basis for the charge(s).  No statement of the facts by defendant - agrees this is his 5th.

Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Ct. 1 - 346.63(1)(a); Ct. 3 - possession of TCH - agrees this is 2nd offense; Ct. 4 - OAR 343.44(1)(4)(B)
Ct. 2 - dismissed.  
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Court orders a PSI
ADA indicates there was previously a PSI in other files.

Court states will finish his sentence in 11 days.  Bond is revoked and defendant is remanded.
Plea hearing on November 3, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua R Pientka in court with attorney Eric P. Sheets. Defendant Joshua R Pientka in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:26 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
Address is verified.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.   
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowlingly and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua R Pientka appeared by video.  Attorney  Eric P Sheets in court for Defendant Joshua R Pientka. Prosecuting Atty David R Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Court calls case at 11:51 AM 
DA Case #: 14PT-1269
ADA  Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of  OWI 5th offense and Possession of THC.
PBT: .08 and admitted to smoking marijuana. Defendant has a prior conviction of possession of THC.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Defendant has been appointed lawyers before, by the Court.  700 West River Drive is Defendant's mailing address.
Defendant works with another contractor installing floors.
Defendant is on a probation hold.

State requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  July 07, 2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. $1,250 cash will have to be posted up front.
